text: In the 1962 federal election in Canada, Edgar-Bernard Charron, a plumber, sought election as a Co-operative Builders of Canada candidate in the south- western Ontario riding of Essex West. He placed last, winning only 261 votes, or 0.7% of the total. Source: Parliament of Canada History of the Federal Electoral Ridings since 1867 ==See also== * List of political parties in Canada Category:Federal political parties in Canada
title: Co-operative Builders of Canada
